comments: If you come to class each day and work for an A you will receive it. Professor Martin was born in Spain and speaks fluent English, so he is very knowledgable about Spanish because it was his first language. The textbook is very very useful and there is a video that goes along with each chapter which keeps students engaged. LOVE THIS PROFESSOR!!!!!!

comments: Professor Martin is an enthusiastic, knowledgeable professor. He is excited to teach every day. He does a very good job of explaining the language and immersing the class in it. Be aware that he does do a lot of in-class group work, so if you don\'t enjoy that kind of thing then avoid the class. It does help you learn the language quicker though.

comments: Oscar Martin is one of the best professors I\'ve had in my college career (currently a junior). I had him for SPA 300. He goes by the syllabus and is willing to help you. He\'s funny and very respectful. His assignments are not hard at all. I would take him again and yes, I recommend him! Take him if you have the opportunity!

comments: This man! He\'s funny and keep the class entertained. BUT! He expects too much. He takes off marks for every mistake. You miss an accent, marks off, wrong article, marks off. He gives no leniency. He doesn\'t really teach either. All he does is give you homework and practice problems. Like are we supposed to know if you don\'t teach?

comments: As long as you hold up your end as the student, this class would quickly become your favorite class. Professor Martin is super funny and energetic, makes class time go by super quickly, although he is fast paced he is super helpful. I highly recommend taking him.

comments: There is A LOT of work in this class. He assigns online homework every class& its 1-3 hours long. You go to the language lab 1 time a week for 8 week. His tests are really hard, and you Must participate. There is a lot of group work. He moves really fast & its a bit confusing but if you need help he is there. Do all the work and you\'ll do good.

comments: Assigns 1.5-3 hrs. home work every single class, several activities and also requires 8 hrs of lab work (required by the dept). Requires you to work in pairs, if you don\'t work well with others it hurts your grade. In addition, the tests are very hard! It\'s a lot of work and would not recommend this class if this is not your major.

comments: Prof. Martin was a great teacher. He moves quickly, but will always explain if you need clarification. Participation is mandatory, but it will help you when it comes time for the tests, which include a small oral section. There is homework due online before coming to class. There are many opportunities to bring up your grade through assignments.

comments: Really good teacher. He\'s cool and understands where we all are coming from. He teaches great, using the textbook, power points, himself, outside examples, etc... So good. He is funny and really a chill guy. Be in class on time, don\'t walk in and out, don\'t use your phone, participate, have fun, and you\'ll get your big fat A! :) RECOMMENDED.

comments: This is the best Spanish 101 professor you can ever have. He is fair(with grades and attendance) and his methods are great. Uses the textbook/workbook and other examples to get the lesson across. He does care about his students and their progress. He doesnt ask above and beyond of you...all he wants (and to pass) is for you to do your part.
